intro: Solanum lycioides var. parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features small, ovate leaves with a hairy texture and produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Its fruit is a smooth, spherical berry that turns from green to red as it matures. The species is part of the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other economically important plants like tomatoes and potatoes.
